intro: Omphalocarpum anocentrum, commonly known as the Australian burr bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiny pods that contain seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by animals. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and inland shrublands. Omphalocarpum anocentrum is an important component of the local flora, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
